title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
fullTitle: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly (1966)

items.author: Dave Kehr
items.content: Though ordained from the beginning, the three-way showdown that climaxes the film is tense and thoroughly astonishing.

items.author: Michael Wilmington
items.content: An improbable masterpiece -- a bizarre mixture of grandly operatic visuals, grim brutality and sordid violence that keeps wrenching you from one extreme to the other.

items.author: Sean Axmaker
items.content: There are two kinds of people, my friend. Those who love Sergio Leone's The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly, and those who resist the machismo and gallows humor of what is arguably the definitive spaghetti western.
A massive, many-faceted film that continues to hold up, viewing after viewing.

items.author: Michael Atkinson
items.content: All told, and in giant widescreen, it's only blood-red adolescent fun, but it blooms like Douglas Sirk with a Gatling gun compared to the teenage demographic's current fare. Matrix, schmatrix: This is the season's supreme party movie.
A curious amalgam of the visually striking, the dramatically feeble and the offensively sadistic.
